oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Illustrations from Harper's Weekly of Generals George H. Thomas and William T. Sherman
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These engraved illustrations of Union Maj. Gen. George H. Thomas and Maj. Gen. William T. Sherman were made from photographs "by Brady." Thomas served in the Western Theater of the war, fought at Stones River, earned the nickname "Rock of Chickamauga," and destroyed the Confederate Army of Tennessee as commander at Nashville, Dec. 1864. Sherman served under Gen. Ulysses S. Grant and succeeded him as Union commander in the Western Theater, captured Atlanta and marched through Georgia to the sea in 1864.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Thomas, George H. (George Henry), 1816-1870; Sherman, William T. (William Tecumseh), 1820-1891
